oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stephen Rust patent
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Patent issued to Stephen Rust for "Wash Board for Washing Clothes" signed by Andrew Jackson and R.B.Taney. Taney was Chief Justice of the U. S. Supreme Court from 1836 until his death in 1864. He is principally remembered for his part in the 1857 Dred Scott case, ruling that "[slaves] had no rights which the white man was bound to respect."
